snippet: Billions of dollars have poured into the continent to fight killer diseases. But the most basic killer, injury, is neglected.
abstract: Op-Ed article by trauma Dr Ola Orekunrin underscores dire need for organized trauma response systems in many African nations; holds while billions of dollars have been invested in fighting killer diseases, injuries have been neglected; calls on global health community to pay attention to Africa's urgent need for emergency medical care.
lead_paragraph: Billions of dollars have poured into the continent to fight killer diseases. But the most basic killer, injury, is neglected.
